title.value: Exploring trust development in families of children towards surgical and emergency care providers: A scoping review of the literature
title.justification: The title should capture the primary focus of the paper.
title.quote: Exploring trust development in families of children towards surgical and emergency care providers: A scoping review of the literature

extractions.description: This paper seeks to identify factors that foster trust development between families of pediatric patients and surgical and emergency care providers. Through a scoping review method, it highlights the importance of communication, competence, dependability, and caring in enhancing trust. The study summarizes findings from 12 relevant articles, emphasizing the need for future research and educational interventions to strengthen parental trust.

type.justification: The study conducts a scoping review of empirical research articles to gather data and findings about trust development in pediatric surgical settings.
type.quote: This scoping review focuses on how trust is established between pediatric doctors and families of pediatric patients in both urgent and surgical care settings.

name.justification: The research specifically targets trust development in pediatric surgical and emergency care settings.
name.quote: Four major trust constructs were identified: competence, communication, dependability, and caring... promoting trust in pediatric surgical and urgent settings.

name.justification: The study also addresses trust development in pediatric emergency care settings.
name.quote: This scoping review focuses on how trust is established between pediatric doctors and families of pediatric patients in both urgent and surgical care settings.
